content.text: Today we are going to learn about a particular holiday in the U.S.
content.name: ccNl

content.text: Presidents' Day was a federal holiday that occurred on the third Monday of February. It originally honored the first president of the United States George Washington, whose birthday was on February 22.
content.name: laJU

content.text: It later moved to the third Monday in February as part of the Uniform Monday Holiday Act of 1971, which had the intention to create holidays with three-day weekends for workers. Some states still celebrated the birthdays of Washington, Abraham Lincoln, and other presidents individually, but Presidents' Day was widely seen as a day to celebrate all U.S. past and present presidents.
content.name: oytm

content.text: Presidents' Day is marked by public ceremonies in Washington, D.C., and throughout the country.  Some people visited monuments and museums dedicated to the presidents, while others enjoyed going out camping and spending time with their families.
